marklogic.body: Yes, this is the perfect way to state it.Â I thought that was Always clear, but apparently very few understand this.Â The Kessel trade I suppose is what has muddied the waters for everyone.Â Plan A consisted of signing UFA's to bolster playoff hopes, and Plan B consisted of acquiring and retaining youth for long term development.Â The Kessel trade kind of combined the two, and for some reason, people think this means Burke abandoned part of his plan.Â God what I wouldn't give to have finished one Spot higher in 2010 and handed the Bruins Gudbranson instead of SeguinÂ - all of this talk would be worthless. - It's not to say Burke is without fault.Â He's made mistakes, particularly in his UFA signings and his philosophical disagreements with Wilson.Â Luckily, I believe these things only hindered Plan A.
